{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3756262,"name":"","username":"yotam201410","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-10-06T11:45:38.024Z","cooked":"

It’s the second time that our Limelight 3 G Ethernet port stopped working in the middle of a match, the usb c port still works, and still connects to the computer through that port. Does anyone have an idea why this thing happens, and if there’s a way to solve it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-10-06T14:54:14.564Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":89.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506904,"topic_slug":"ll3g-ethernet-port-stopped-working","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51413,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ll3g-ethernet-port-stopped-working/506904/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3756317,"name":"Tyler Holtzman","username":"Holtzman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/holtzman/{size}/113510_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-06T14:36:01.428Z","cooked":"

We’ve had issues a few times with ethernet cables not unique to Limelight and this is what we’ve found helped with making our electrical and control systems robust. Some issues stem from the fact that the RJ45 connector itself is not suitable for the types of shock loads and vibration we commonly see on a modern FRC robot. This can make troubleshooting this type of issue in the pits very difficult because you can’t replicate the issue outside of a match.

We take these steps now for all signal/communication cables.

  1. Use high quality ethernet cables(not the cheapest ones off amazon). Ideally shielded with a metal jacket on the connector. Avoid home made cables.
  2. Physically strain relieve all control/signal cables as close as possible to the connection point
  3. Put generous gob of Hot glue all Ethernet/usb cables. (The LL4 gets fairly warm and standard temp hot glue would soften and let go over many heat cycles, so we use switched to a higher temp hot glue)

This is a screenshot of our Limelight mount. Note the small tie wrap securing the ethernet cable right beside the limelight.

image936×726 78.2 KB

Hope this helps.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-10-06T14:36:01.428Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":172.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506904,"topic_slug":"ll3g-ethernet-port-stopped-working","display_username":"Tyler Holtzman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2287,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ll3g-ethernet-port-stopped-working/506904/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":9}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3756330,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-06T15:01:43.769Z","cooked":"

We’ve had some instances of bad cables as Holtzman said, but have also had 1 random instance of a port itself stop working that we never had a chance to diagnose on an LL3. The Limelight support ticket we submitted got us a replacement with no hassle though. Luckily we have not had port issues with LL4 so far.

If your camera took a hit, check for bent pins at the rj45?

All good advice but be careful of this not always true:

Holtzman:

strain relieve all control/signal cables as close as possible to the connection point

If there isn’t already a strain relief, then there is a minimum distance that still allows the pins to float for good contact and no stress to disconnect them. Example spec for Molex SL:

Looking for comprehensive list of wire stripping lengths for FRC components Electrical
Another important dimension is the minimum distance to the tie-down to let the terminals float so they align well upon insertion and aren’t continuously stressed. An example from the Molex SL specification PS-73838-005-001.pdf [image]
